workflow.name: btap_create_necb_prototype_building
workflow.description: This measure creates an NECB prototype building from scratch and uses it as the base for an analysis.

workflow.name: btap_set_wall_conductance_by_necb_climate_zone
workflow.description: Modifies wall conductances by climate zone.

workflow.name: btap_set_roof_conductance_by_necb_climate_zone
workflow.description: Modifies roof conductances by climate zone.

workflow.name: replace_hva_cwith_gsh_pand_doas
workflow.display_name: Replace HVAC with GSHP and DOAS
workflow.measure_definition_display_name: Replace HVAC with GSHP and DOAS
workflow.description: Measure replaces existing HVAC system (if any) with a Ground Source Heat Pump (GSHP) with DOAS HVAC system (one DOAS per floor).  The GSHP with DOAS system (centralized DOAS, with zone level conditioning) is applied to all space types except storage spaces like stairwells, mechanical/electrical rooms etc.

arguments.display_name: GSHP DX Heating Coil Heating COP
arguments.name: gshp_htg_cop

arguments.display_name: GSHP DX Cooling Coil Cooling EER
arguments.name: gshp_clg_eer

arguments.display_name: GSHP Fan Type: PSC or ECM?
arguments.name: gshp_fan_type

arguments.display_name: Boiler Design Heating Water Outlet Temperature (F)
arguments.name: boiler_hw_st

arguments.display_name: DOAS Fan Flow Control - Variable means DCV controls
arguments.name: doas_fan_type

arguments.display_name: Apply recommended availability and ventilation schedules for air handlers?
arguments.name: remake_schedules

argument.display_name: Skip Replace HVAC with GSHP and DOAS
argument.name: __SKIP__

variables.display_name: Skip Replace HVAC with GSHP and DOAS

workflow.name: btap_results
workflow.description: This measure creates BTAP result values used for NRCan analyses.

workflow.name: openstudio_results
workflow.description: This measure creates high level tables and charts pulling both from model inputs and EnergyPlus results. It has building level information as well as detail on space types, thermal zones, HVAC systems, envelope characteristics, and economics. Click the heading above a chart to view a table of the chart data.
